page.title: 15THE RAILWAY
page.content: The railway line from Manchester to Leeds passes through Castleton. It was opened in 1839, and the entance to the station was opposite the Director's Inn in the village centre. The Inn took its name from the fact that the directors of the railway used to hold meetings and dinners there. At first, passengers going westwards to Heywood and Bury had to travel by canal barge but later a railway line was built and the barge was converted into a public house in another part of Rochdale called Belfield. The name of the station was changed to Castleton in 1875 and the present station was opened in 1877.
